reference.title: serviced backup
reference.shortdesc: The serviced backup command saves a snapshot of the current state of the system, the state of all services, and application data to a compressed tar archive file (.tgz).

section.p: You can back up the entire system or exclude certain directories, such as a directory that contains application performance data.

dlentry.dd: Subdirectory of the tenant volumes to exclude from a backup.

Attempt to perform a backup even if the check for sufficient storage space failed. Use this override option with caution. If the backup exhausts storage space on the device, you must restart serviced.
